column1: By this time the sun was about to set
column2: and all of a sudden the sky became as dark as if it had been covered with a thick cloud. I was much astonished at this sudden darkness
column3: but much more when I found it occasioned by a bird of a monstrous size
column4: that came flying toward me. I remembered that I had often heard mariners speak of a miraculous bird called the roc
column5: and conceived that the great dome which I so much admired must be its egg. In short

column8: I crept close to the egg
column9: so that I had before me one of the legs of the bird
column10: which was as big as the trunk of a tree. I tied myself strongly to it with my turban
column11: in hopes that the roc next morning would carry me with her out of this desert island. After having passed the night in this condition
column12: the bird flew away as soon as it was daylight
column13: and carried me so high that I could not discern the earth; she afterward descended with so much rapidity that I lost my senses.
